field.name: description
field.value:
PropertyEmitter assumes that all properties have backing methods whose names match the name of the property. For instance, it assumes that a property called Foo has backing methods get_Foo() and set_Foo().
In reality, the interface type defines the names of the backing methods in addition to the name of the property. If an interface defines the names of the backing methods to be something other than get_/set_, DynamicProxy will create a type that doesn't implement the interface correctly and System.Reflection.Emit.TypeBuilder.CreateType() throws System.TypeLoadException
Note that a property that does not define its methods as get_/set_ may not conform to the CLS (10.4 Naming patterns, http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/Ecma-335.pdf).

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: Can you provide a failing test for that?

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: As far as I know this works on the trunk. Please create a failing test.
